sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 1, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Mozio (Br.): Einforderung.
Vor Tisch ein Diktat.
An Kammerer (K.): Bestellung.

Lie-Liechen fühlt Schmerzen nach einer älteren Fußverletzung, fühlt sich auch fiebrig! Um 6h kommt Dr. Fuchs – bestätigt das Fieber, vielleicht Influenza, wünscht Ruhe – dennoch Patiençe. Das Mädchen läuft aus dem Hause, gegen die Abmachung, gegen das Verbot, gleich nach dem Eintritt des Arztes – Lie-Liechen kündigt ihr sofort, bestellt die Paula brieflich für den 15. d. M.
To Mozio (letter): demand.
Before lunch, a dictation.
To Kammerer (postcard): order.

Lie-Liechen feels pains arising from an old injury to her foot, also feels feverish! Dr. Fuchs comes at 6 o’clock: confirms the fever, perhaps influenza, asks her to rest – but playing solitaire is all right. The maid runs out of the house, against our arrangement, against the proscription, as soon as the doctor arrives – Lie-Liechen sacks her immediately, asks Paula – by letter – to come on the 15th of the month.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 2, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Lie-Liechen hatte eine gute Nacht, fühlt sich fieberfrei. – Gott sei Dank!
Von Jonas (K.OJ 12/6, [46]): wegen Krankheit im Rückstand – wird mit Furtwängler eine Unterredung haben.
Dr. Fuchs um 6h: findet etwas Fieber.
Frl. Pechaček bringt die (nach Braun) kopierte Weste: 19 S.
Zeitig zu Bett.
Lie-Liechen has a good night, feels free of fever. – thanks be to God!
From Jonas (postcardOJ 12/6, [46]): on account of illness, he is behind schedule – he will have a discussion with Furtwängler.
Dr. Fuchs at 6 o’clock: he detects some fever.
Miss Pechaček brings the waistcoat (modeled after Braun): 19 shillings.
Early to bed.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 3, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Mittler (K.): war verhindert, habe die Karten vergeben. A week earlier, Schenker had received an invitation from Franz Mittler to attend an evening of new compositions (see diary entry for October 23, 1933).
Nach der Jause in der Apotheke – es regnet.
Lie-Liechen kann nicht ausgehen!
To Mittler (postcard): I was indisposed, gave the tickets away.
After teatime, in the drugstore – it rains
Lie-Liechen cannot go outside!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 4, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Um 9h Dr. Fuchs: das Fieber ist zurückgegangen, der Fuß braucht noch Behandlung.
Wir bleiben zuhause.

An Rinn (Br.): ob der zweite Aufsatz vorangehen kann? Schenker was working on two articles for the Deutsche Zeitschrift. The "second" of these was Vom Unterschied zwischen der italienischen und der deutschen Musik, published in vol. 47 in August 1934 (pp. 700–3). Schenker had been working on the other, on Joseph Haydn, but never completed it; file 49 in the Oster Collection contains extensive materials for it.

An Dr. Klein (Br.): Bestellung, wenn keine Schwierigkeiten entstehen. A subscription to the recently established weekly paper, Deutsche Zukunft, of which Klein was its first editor-in-chief (see the diary entries for October 26 and 30, and for December 14, 1933).
At 9 o’clock, Dr. Fuchs: the fever has receded, the foot still needs treatment.
We stay at home.
To Rinn (letter): can the second article come first?
To Dr. Klein (letter): subscription, if no difficulties arise.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 5, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: 11–¾12h im Freien.
An Weil (Br.): angeschrieben!?
Um 6h Diktat zum freien Satz.
Um 9h abends Dr. Fuchs: stellt entgegen unseren Befürchtungen eine Besserung fest.
Das Mädchen kommt erst um 11h nachhause!
11 to 11:45 out of doors
To Weil (letter): are we in his bad books!?
At 6 o’clock, dictation for Free Composition.
At 9 in the evening, Dr. Fuchs: he confirms an improvement in Jeanette’s condition, in spite of our fears to the contrary.
The maid does not come home until 11 o’clock!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 6, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von v. Hoboken (2 Br.): aus München; kommt Freitag, bittet, meine Zeit für ihn nicht auf die zwei Stunden zu beschränken!!!
Von Mittler (Br.): dankt für mein „rührendes Betragen“, hofft nicht irrezugehen!
An v. Hoboken (Br.): erwarte sie Freitag zur Jause.
An Floriz (K.OJ 8/5, [24]): über Lie-Liechens Hausarrest, Mädchenwechsel, Hobokens Brief, möchte ihn noch vor Freitag sehen!
An Deutsch (K.): Zitat aus dem Brief v. Hobokens.
An Dr. Neumann (K.): Erklärung.
Geld erlegt an Saphir u. die Südmark.
Von 6–¾7 Bamberger: bringt Konzertkarten für Samstag.

v. Webern dirigirt op. 11 von Brahms recht frei, suchend, leider nicht findend. According to the radio listings in the Neue freie Presse, Webern conducted the Vienna Symphony Orchestra. In addition to Brahms’s First Serenade, the program also included the Overture to Schubert’s Rosamunde and Webern’s arrangement of Schubert’s German Dances.
From Hoboken (2 letters), from Munich: he is coming on Friday, requests that I do not restrict my time for him to the two hours of lessons!!!
From Mittler (letter): thanks for my "touching behavior," hopes he is not making a mistake!
To Hoboken (letter): I expect them Friday for afternoon snack.
To Floriz (postcardOJ 8/5, [24]): concerning Lie-Liechen’s confinement, change of maids, Hoboken’s letter; I would still like to see him before Friday!
To Deutsch (postcard): excerpt from Hoboken’s letter
To Dr. Neumann (postcard): explanation.
Money paid to Saphir and the Südmark.
From 6 o’clock to 6:45, Bamberger: brings concert tickets for Saturday.
Webern conducts Brahms’s Op. 11 quite freely, searching but unfortunately not finding.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 7, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Um ½3 Dr. Fuchs erteilt Lie-Liechen Absolutorium – Gott sei Dank – untersucht mich, findet mich durchaus gut – kalt u. heiße, wechselweise usw.! Bittet um ein Autograph für den Sohn.
At 2:30, Dr. Fuchs confers deliverance upon Lie-Liechen – thanks be to God. He examines me, finds that I am thoroughly well – cold and hot, in alternation, etc.! Requests an autograph for his son.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 8, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: v. Hoboken (Br.): bittet um Samstag oder Sonntag.
Lie-Liechen geht zum erstenmal aus – kaufen Chrysanthemen als erster Weg!
Kammerer stimmt.
Hoboken (letter): asks to come on Saturday or Sunday.
Lie-Liechen goes out for the first time – we buy chrysanthemums as our first errand!
Kammerer tunes the piano.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 9, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Dr. Fritz Klein (Br.): setzt mich als „Bezieher“ ein On November 4, Schenker had written to Klein to say that he would subscribe to his weekly paper, Deutsche Zukunft (see the diary entries from November 4 and December 14). – „Spaß“!?!
An v. H. (Br.): also bitte Samstag.
An Floriz (Br.OJ 6/8, [27] durch Wolf): die Konzertkarten zum Bamberger-Abend.
Lie-Liechen übergibt selbst dem Dr. Fuchs die beiden Autogramme (Furtwängler!).
Von Deutsch (K.OJ 10/3, [200]): dankt schön für die „unschönen“ Nachrichten; bittet um eine Aussprache.
From Dr. Fritz Klein (letter): he instates me as a "subscriber" – "a joke"!?!
To Hoboken (letter): all right, come on Saturday.
To Floriz (letterOJ 6/8, [27], via Wolf): the concert tickets for the Bamberger evening.
Lie-Liechen gives the two autographs (mine and Furtwängler’s!) to Dr. Fuchs herself.
From Deutsch (postcardOJ 10/3, [200]): kind thanks for the "unkind" news: asks to speak with me.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 10, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Weil (Br. abgeschlossen): über den Juden Schenker.
Nach der Jause holen wir beim Zahnarzt das Zahnstück ab.
Nach der Patiençe bekomme ich einen heftigen Schwindelanfall – Dr. Roscas kommt – Besorgnis!
To Weil (the letter concluded): concerning Schenker the Jew.
After teatime, we collect the prosthesis from the dentist.
After playing solitaire, I suffer a severe fainting attack – Dr. Roscas comes – concern!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 11, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Um 9h Dr. Roscas: gibt Verhaltungsmaßregeln.
Aus Vorsicht sage ich Frl. Elias tel. ab.

Ein zweiter Schwindelanfall! – Frühmann könnte die Jause
mit v. H. u. Frau nicht verantworten – sie wird abgesagt u. nur Herr v. H. zu einem Händedruck gebeten – bleibt von 6–7h – herzlich – ich verspreche, ihm keinen Geldschaden zu machen – er erwidert kein Wort!!!
Roscas um 9h abends: findet mich gut, kein Medikament mehr.
At 9 o’clock, Dr. Roscas: gives instructions on how to take care of myself.
For sake of caution, I telephone Miss Elias to cancel.

A second fainting spell! – Frühmann cannot take responsibility for the afternoon snack
with Hoboken and his wife – she is canceled, and only Mr. Hoboken is invited for a handshake. He stays from 6 to 7 o’clock – cordial – I promise not to inflict any financial damage on him – he does not say a word in response!!!
Roscas at 9 o’clock in the evening: he finds me well, no more medication.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 12, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Sehr gute Nacht, bleibe bis 10h im Bett.
Um 10h Frühmann: ist zufrieden.
Fanny Violin um 12h, bleibt eine halbe Stunde.
Wir bleiben zuhause, ich diktire, Lie-Liechen schreibt gleich.
Rf. bis ½10h.
A very good night; I stay in bed until 10 o’clock.
At 10 o’clock, Frühmann: he is satisfied.
Fanny Violin at 12 o’clock, stays for half an hour.
We stay at home; I dictate, Lie-Liechen writes immediately.
Radio until 9:30.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 13, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 14, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Deutsch (Br.OJ 10/3, [201] vertraulich!!!!): berichtet, was Architekt Schmid Possibly Heinrich Schmid (1885–1949), a pupil of Otto Wagner, who designed numerous buildings for the city of Vienna during the interwar period. über v. H.s Pläne weiß – Deutsch versucht jetzt andere Wege zu v. H.
v. H. zur ersten Stunde, bleibt 1½ Stunden – ich bin entsetzlich müde!
From Deutsch (letterOJ 10/3, [201], in confidence!!!!): reports on what the architect Schmid knows about Hoboken’s plans – Deutsch will now attempt other ways of approaching Hoboken.
Hoboken for his first lesson, stays 1½ hours – I am frightfully tired!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 15, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: „Obligate Lage“ abgeschlossen.
Paula tritt wieder ein.
Nach der Jause erster Ausgang – Lie-Liechen führt mich!
"Obligatory Register" completed.
Paula returns again.
After teatime, the first outing – Lie-Liechen leads me!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 16, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Albersheim (Br.): Einladung zu seinem Vortrag.
Der Schalter in meinem Zimmer funktionirt nicht.
From Albersheim (letter): invitation to his lecture.
The switch in my bedroom does not work.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 17, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Nach der Jause geht Lie-Liechen ihre Wege, ich mit v. H. in der blauen Stube: Scherzo op. 54.
After teatime, Lie-Liechen does her errands, I stay with Hoboken in the blue room: Chopin’s Scherzo Op. 54.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 18, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Wir rufen Mozio an, ich erinnere ihn, er antwortet unwillig: Sorgen – keine Zeit zu kommen – !
An Albersheim (K.): danke für die Einladung, bitte um einen Abdruck!
An Haas (Br.): Dank (Montag für Hans Wolf als Boten vorbereitet!).
Nach der Jause mit Lie-Liechen, es geht ganz gut.
We telephone Mozio; I remind him, he replies reluctantly: troubles – no time to come – !
To Albersheim (postcard): thanks for the invitation, request a printout!
To Haas (letter): thanks (I prepare him to receive Hans Wolf as a messenger on Monday!).
After teatime, with Lie-Liechen; it goes very well.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 19, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Beispiele zur Artikulation in Der freie Satz zusammengestellt.
Die Jause bei Sacher.
Examples for "Articulation" in Free Composition put together.
Afternoon snack at the Sacher.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 20, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Sophie (K.): ob die Bilder angekommen sind.

An die
Mercurbank (Br.): die Zinsen sind zu schicken.
Ein Patiençe in zwei Legen.
From Sophie (postcard): did the pictures arrive?

To the
Mercurbank (letter): the interest should be sent.
A game of solitaire completed in two rounds.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 21, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Jetty (K.): kommt morgen.
v. Hoboken erklärt sich für Wien, Widerstand der Frau, „vor Allem habe ich Sie hier“!!
Telephonische Mitteilung an Frau Deutsch – Lie-Liechen fragt dann noch einmal an, ob Frau D. nicht eine Partnerin für Frau v. H. wüßte.
From Jetty (postcard): she will come tomorrow.
Hoboken declares himself in favor of Vienna; opposition from his wife: "above all, I have you here"!!
Telephone communication to Mrs. Deutsch – Lie-Liechen then asks once again whether Mrs. Deutsch would know of a female partner for Mrs. Hoboken.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 22, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Sophie (K.): Dank für Brief u. Karte.
Von Weigl (K.OJ 15/11, [3]): macht auf die Ravag-Vorführung eines neuen Werkes aufmerksam.
Von der Steuerbehörde: Mahnung um S. 164.
Nach Tisch holen wir vom Zahnarzt die zweite Prothese.
Bei Pirringer Droste für mich gekauft.
Jetty von ½5–7h.
Wieder eine Patiençe in zwei Legen.
To Sophie (postcard): thanks for her letter and postcard.
From Weigl (postcardOJ 15/11, [3]): alerts me to the performance of a new work on the radio.
From the tax authorities: reminder about the 164 shillings.
After lunch, we collect the second prosthesis from the dentist.
At Pirringer’s, Droste candies purchased for me.
Jetty from 4:30 to 7 o’clock.
Another game of solitaire completed in two rounds.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 23, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Vom Herder-Lexikon (Br.): Einladung.
Floriz um 4h: weiß von Dr. Violin um v. H.s Absicht in Wien zu bleiben.
Eine Zweier-Lege.
From Herder’s encyclopedia (letter): invitation.
Floriz at 4 o’clock: he knows, through Dr. Violin, about Hoboken’s intention to remain in Vienna.
A game of solitaire completed in two rounds.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 24, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Die Briefmappe endlich entleert!
The correspondence folder finally emptied!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 25, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Albersheim (Br.): schickt den Vortrag; – sucht Schüler!!
Um 11h: Diktat zur Artikulation in Der freie Satz.
Nach der Jause: Wege, Blumen.
Lie-Liechen schreibt bis spät nachts.
From Albersheim (letter): sends his lecture, is seeking pupils!!
At 11 o’clock, dictation for "Articulation" in Free Composition.
After teatime: errands, flowers.
Lie-Liechen writes until late at night.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 26, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Jause bei Sacher, v. H. kommt mit der Gattin – das Band hängt an einem Faden.
Abends Lese der Korrektur.
Lie-Liechen schreibt bis 1h nachts.
Afternoon snack at the Sacher; Hoboken comes with his wife – their bond hangs by a thread.
In the evening, reading of the corrected copy.
Lie-Liechen writes until 1 o’clock in the evening.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 27, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:div.tei:opener: 27. Nach verregneter Nacht noch immer regnerisch.

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Floriz (K.OJ 8/5, [25]): Mittwoch soll das Ehepaar v. H. zu uns kommen.
Telephonisches Gespräch mit Frau Deutsch: Mittwoch Jause bei uns, wir werden berichten.
An Weigl (K.): danke für die Einladung zum Lautsprecher.

tei:div.tei:opener: 27, after a rainy night, it is still rainy.

tei:ab.tei:seg: To Floriz (postcardOJ 8/5, [25]): on Wednesday the Hobokens are planning to come to us.
Telephone conversation with Mrs. Deutsch: afternoon snack at our place on Wednesday, we shall report.
To Weigl (postcard): thanks for the invitation to the loudspeaker.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 28, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Deutsch (K.OJ 10/3, [202]): ersucht mich Architekt Schmid Possibly Heinrich Schmid (1885–1949), a pupil of Otto Wagner, who designed numerous buildings for the city of Vienna during the interwar period. zu empfangen.
Telephonisch Schmid für morgen 11h bestellt.

Schmid See fn.1 von 11–½1h:
hat Platz u. Plan für Hobokens Haus – bittet um meine Unterstützung.

Von Oppel (Br.): schickt eine neue Deutschland-Hymne von Knettel, ein Bildchen von Beppo u. eine Einladung der Goos-Schule zu einer Schenker-Vorlesung; im Brief eine gute Musikkritik, über die Verhältnisse. Das Nebeneinander von Hitler, Goebels u. Schenker wirkt sehr erheiternd.
Nach Tisch zur Mercurbank: werden beruhigt.
v. H. erklärt sich unumwunden gegen seine Frau, hält den Zustand für unhaltbar – er will in Wien bleiben.

Die Rf.-Sendung aus London sehr gefeilt, doch von geringem Gehalt („Unterhaltungskonzert“). According to the radio listings in the Neue freie Presse, the baritone Raymond Newell and the Wireless Male Voice Chorus, under the direction of Joseph Lewis, performed English-language student and folk songs; this was followed by a concert of the Wireless Military Band under B. Walton O’Donnell, with Cecil Baumer at the piano, performing works by Johan Wagenaar, Percy Pitt, Isaac Albéniz, and René Lenormand.
From Deutsch (postcardOJ 10/3, [202]): asks me to receive the architect Schmid.
I ask Schmid, by telephone, to come at 11 o’clock.

Schmid from 11 to 12:30:
he has a place and a plan for Hoboken’s house – he asks for my support.

From Oppel (letter): sends a new hymn to Germany by Knettel, a snapshot of Beppo, and an invitation from Goos’s school to a lecture on Schenker; in the letter, a good music review; concerning the conditions in Germany. The juxtaposition of the names Hitler, Goebbels, and Schenker has a very amusing effect.
After lunch, to the Mercurbank: we are calmed.
Hoboken expresses himself openly against his wife, regards the situation as unsustainable – he intends to remain in Vienna.
The radio broadcast from London very polished, but of meager content ("concert of light music").

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 29, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Mozio noch immer kein Geld.
Von der Krankenkasse (Br.): drückt sich noch um die Operationskosten.
Den Fragebogen für Herder ausgefüllt; – Brief dazu mit Dank.
v. Hoboken um 12h: sagt die Frau ab – rufen Dr. Baumgarten, er sagt zu.
Um 5h Dr. B., um ½6h v. H. – sehr verstört, bleiben bis ½8h.
From Mozio, as always, no money.
From the health insurance company (letter): they are still pressing for the cost of the operation.
The questionnaire for Herder complete; – covering letter, with thanks.
Hoboken at 12 o’clock: his wife declines the invitation to afternoon snack – we telephone Dr. Baumgarten, he accepts.
At 5 o’clock, Dr. Baumgarten arrives, at 5:30 Hoboken – very distraught. They stay until 7:30.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker November 30, 1933
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Wolf versucht: „… Mama läßt fragen . .“ wehre energisch ab!
In den Herder-Fragebogen statt Galizien „Polen“ eingesetzt.

An die Krankenkasse (Br.): Lie-Liechen fordert die für Verpflegung gezahlten S. 103 zurück abzüglich der Zuschlagszahlung von S. 20.20. As can be seen from earlier diary entries, the Schenkers were required to pay a precautionary 103 shillings towards the cost of their maid Paula Juran’s hospitalization on September 24, 1933, on account of an abscess.
Wolf attempts: "… Mama would like to know …" I defend myself energetically!
In the Herder questionnaire, instead of Galicia, "Poland" inserted.
To the health insurance company (letter): Lie-Liechen demands that the 103 shillings she paid for care be returned, in the light of the supplementary payment of 20.20 shillings.
